info.title: KCardSwap API
info.description: Backend API for KCardSwap - Card Exchange Platform

get.description: Health check endpoint for container orchestration.
API health check endpoint.
Root endpoint.

post.description: Authenticate admin user with email and password. Only users with admin or super_admin role can login.

401.description: Invalid credentials or not an admin

post.description: Authenticate user with Google OAuth token and receive JWT tokens
Authenticate user with Google OAuth authorization code and PKCE code_verifier (Expo AuthSession)
Use refresh token from httpOnly cookie to obtain new access and refresh tokens

get.description: Retrieve the authenticated user's profile information

put.description: Update the authenticated user's profile information

get.description:
Get a list of all available K-pop idol groups for onboarding.

    This endpoint provides the complete list of idol groups that users can select
    during the onboarding process to indicate their preferences.

    Each idol group includes:
    - `id`: Unique identifier (e.g., newjeans, ive, aespa)
    - `name`: Display name (e.g., NewJeans, IVE, aespa)
    - `emoji`: Emoji representing the group (e.g., ðŸ‘–, ðŸ¦¢, ðŸ¦‹)

    This is a **public endpoint** that **does not require authentication**.
    Frontend applications should use this to dynamically populate idol group selection.

200.description: List of all idol groups retrieved successfully

post.description: Generate a signed URL for uploading a card image to GCS

get.description: Retrieve all cards owned by the authenticated user

delete.description: Delete a card owned by the authenticated user

get.description: Check current upload quota usage

post.description: Confirm that the card image has been successfully uploaded to GCS after using the signed URL

400.description: Invalid request (already confirmed, no image, etc.)

404.description: Card not found or image not found in storage

post.description: Search for cards near a specific location. Free users: 5 searches/day. Premium users: unlimited.

put.description: Update the user's current location for nearby search visibility

post.description: Send a friend request to another user

422.description: Unprocessable entity (cannot send request - already friends, pending, or blocked)

post.description: Accept a pending friend request

403.description: Forbidden (not authorized to accept this request)

post.description: Block another user (prevents all interactions)
Unblock a previously blocked user (allows future interactions)

get.description: Get list of friends (optionally filtered by status)

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by friendship status (accepted, pending, blocked). If not provided, returns all friendships.
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by friendship status (accepted, pending, blocked). If not provided, returns all friendships.

get.description: Get all chat rooms for the current user
Get messages from a chat room (with pagination support via after_message_id)

parameters.name: after_message_id

schema.description: Get messages after this message ID
schema.title: After Message Id

parameters.description: Get messages after this message ID

403.description: Forbidden (not a participant of this room)

post.description: Send a message in a chat room (triggers FCM push notification)
Mark a message as read by the current user
Submit a rating for another user (based on friendship or completed trade)

get.description: Get ratings received by a specific user
Get average rating score for a specific user
Get reports submitted by the current user

post.description: Submit a report for inappropriate behavior or content
Create a new trade proposal between two users
Accept a trade proposal (responder only)
Reject a trade proposal (responder only)
Cancel a trade (either party can cancel)
Confirm trade completion (each party confirms independently)

get.description: Get all trades for current user (as initiator or responder)

post.description:
Verify Google Play purchase receipt and update subscription.

Features:
- Idempotent: Same token + same user returns current status
- Token binding: Prevents cross-user replay attacks
- Auto-acknowledge: Acknowledges purchase after verification

Error codes:
- 400_VALIDATION_FAILED: Invalid platform or missing fields
- 401_UNAUTHORIZED: Not logged in
- 409_CONFLICT: Purchase token already used by another user
- 503_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE: Google Play API unavailable

get.description:
Get current subscription status for authenticated user.

Returns server-side subscription state.
Called by app when opening or returning to foreground.

Error codes:
- 401_UNAUTHORIZED: Not logged in
- 503_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE: Database unavailable

post.description:
Expire active subscriptions that have passed their expiry date.

This endpoint should be called by a scheduled background task (e.g., daily cron job).
For POC, it's exposed as an HTTP endpoint for manual triggering.

In production, this should be:
- Protected by admin authentication or internal-only access
- Triggered by a scheduler (APScheduler, Celery Beat, Cloud Scheduler, etc.)

Returns:
    Number of subscriptions expired and processing timestamp

post.summary: Create a new post (V2: with scope/category)
post.description: Create a new post. Requires authentication. Free users limited to 2 posts per day, Premium to 20.

422.description: Unprocessable entity (daily limit exceeded or validation failed)

get.summary: List posts (V2: global/city filtering with category)
get.description: List posts. FR-005: Global view (no city_code) shows all posts; City view (with city_code) shows city-specific posts.

parameters.name: city_code

schema.description: Optional city filter (omit for global view)
schema.title: City Code

parameters.description: Optional city filter (omit for global view)

post.description: Express interest in a post. Cannot express interest in your own post or duplicate interests.
Accept an interest. Automatically creates friendship and chat room.
Reject an interest. Only post owner can reject.
Manually close a post. Only post owner can close.

get.summary: List interests for a post (owner only)
get.description: List all interests for a specific post. Only post owner can view.
Get details of a specific interest. Only post owner can view.

post.summary: Toggle like on a post (FR-008, FR-009)
post.description: Like or unlike a post. Idempotent: if already liked, unlikes; if not liked, likes. Each user can like a post at most once.

get.description:
Get a list of all available Taiwan cities/counties.

    This endpoint provides the complete list of Taiwan's 22 cities/counties including:
    - **Six Special Municipalities** (ç›´è½„å¸‚): Taipei, New Taipei, Taoyuan, Taichung, Tainan, Kaohsiung
    - **Provincial Cities** (çœè½„å¸‚): Hsinchu City, Chiayi City
    - **Counties** (ç¸£): Hsinchu County, Miaoli, Changhua, Nantou, Yunlin, Chiayi County, Pingtung, Yilan, Hualien, Taitung, Penghu, Kinmen, Lienchiang

    Each city includes:
    - `code`: City code used in APIs (e.g., TPE, NTP, TAO)
    - `name`: English name (e.g., Taipei City)
    - `name_zh`: Chinese name (e.g., å°åŒ—å¸‚)

    This is a public endpoint that **does not require authentication**.
    Frontend applications should use this to dynamically populate city selection dropdowns.

200.description: List of all Taiwan cities retrieved successfully

get.description: View another user's public gallery cards (requires authentication).
Get the authenticated user's own gallery cards.

post.description: Create a new gallery card in the user's personal album.

delete.description: Delete a gallery card (only owner can delete).

put.description: Update the display order of gallery cards.

post.description: Step 1: Generate a presigned URL for uploading media to GCS. FR-006.
Step 2: Confirm that media was uploaded to GCS. Applies quota. FR-022, T052.
Step 3: Attach confirmed media to a post. FR-007.
Step 3: Attach confirmed media to a gallery card. FR-007, FR-020.

Create a message request to another user.

Implements FR-011: Message Requests for strangers.
Implements FR-013: Privacy setting to block stranger messages.
Implements FR-014: One unique thread per user pair.

get.description:
Get message requests for the current user.

Supports FR-016: Inbox clearly separates Requests vs Threads.

Query params:
- status_filter: "pending", "accepted", "declined", or "all" (default: "pending")

schema.title: Response Get My Message Requests Api V1 Message Requests Inbox Get

post.description:
Accept a message request and create a thread.

Implements FR-012: Recipient can accept/decline requests.
Creates unique thread (FR-014).

Decline a message request.

Implements FR-012: Recipient can accept/decline requests.

get.description:
Get all threads for the current user.

Supports FR-016: Inbox clearly separates Requests vs Threads.
Returns threads ordered by last_message_at descending.

Get messages in a thread.

Returns messages ordered by created_at ascending (oldest first).
User must be part of the thread to view messages.

post.description:
Send a message in a thread.

Supports FR-015: Messages can reference post_id.
User must be part of the thread to send messages.
